%text The rule is \[ \qquad \lim_{x\to 0} \frac{\sin Mx}{Mx} = 1 \] Which is why % \begin{align}
\lim_{x\to 0} \frac{2\sin^2 2x}{x^2} &= \lim_{x\to 0} 2 \left(\frac{\sin 2x}{2x} \right)^2\times 4 \\ &= 8\cdot \underbrace{\lim_{x\to 0} \left(\frac{\sin 2x}{2x} \right)^2}_{=1} = 8 \end{align} %text %
